docs.title: Nextflow Tutorial with Freyja
docs.text: Welcome to the Nextflow Training Tutorial! This tutorial is designed to teach you Nextflow by using examples with Freyja, a tool for analyzing SARS-CoV-2 wastewater sequencing data.

docs.title: What You'll Learn
docs.text:
• Introduction to Nextflow – Basics, syntax, and workflow concepts
  • Understanding Freyja – What it does and how it works
  • Building a Nextflow pipeline to process sequencing data using Freyja
  • Running and optimizing Nextflow workflows

docs.title: Setting Up Nextflow and Freyja
docs.text: Before we start building workflows, let’s set up our environment by installing Nextflow and Freyja.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Make sure you have: - A Linux or macOS system (Windows users can use WSL). - Java 8 or higher installed. - Python 3 installed.

docs.title: Installing Nextflow
docs.text:
Nextflow requires Java 8+ and can be installed using the following command:

curl -s https://get.nextflow.io | bash
chmod +x nextflow
sudo mv nextflow /usr/local/bin

To verify installation, run:

nextflow -version

docs.title: Installing Freyja
docs.text:
Freyja requires Python 3 and can be installed via pip:

pip install freyja

To check if Freyja is installed correctly run:

freyja --help

docs.title: Alternative installation via conda
docs.text:
If you prefer using Conda, first ensure it is installed. If not, follow the official installation guide.

Once Conda is set up, create a new environment named training-tutorial with Python by running:

conda create -n training-tutorial python=3.9

Activate the environment:

conda activate training-tutorial

Now, install Nextflow and Freyja using conda:

conda install bioconda::nextflow
conda install bioconda::freyja
